NHL, players' union reach tentative deal to end lockout

A tentative agreement was announced early this morning to end the nearly four-month-old lockout that threatened to wipe out what was left of an already abbreviated season. (AP, 9:18 a.m.)

After lockout, what's ahead for Bruins?

The Globe's Fluto Shinzawa addresses some of the pressing questions the Bruins will now look to answer heading into training camp. (Globe, 9:45 a.m.)

Child injured in Chelmsford blaze

Officials said several people were rescued during the fire at the Woodcrest Condominiums including a young boy who was airlifted to a hospital. (AP, 10:20 a.m.)
